results.title: Eight millimeter [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Joel Schumacher, Judy Hofflund and Gavin Polone
results.brief_description: A widow settling her husband’s estate, finds an 8mm film in his safe. The film on the reel is a “snuff” film, and shows a young girl being tortured and killed. Upset by the film, she hires private detective Tom Welles (Nicolas Cage) to find the girl on the film and determine if the film is real. When Tom learns the girl on the film is a runaway, his investigation takes him to Hollywood, where with the help of Max (Joaquin Phoenix), a clerk in an adult bookstore, he discovers the world of underground pornography, and his initial investigation becomes an obsession.

results.title: Eight litres a minute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Battle for the planet”.
Profiles a serious form of air pollution in the West: acid rain particularly addressing the export of air pollution to the Third World as evidenced in Mexico and Brazil. As meaningful attempts seek to solve acid rain in Europe, European and North American corporations are relocating their dirty industries to countries with lower pollution standards. Third World governments admit polluters as they bring the promise of employment and wealth. Examines the impact on the people of Mexico City and the refinery city of Cubatao in Brazil. In both cities 45-50% of the major polluting companies are foreign and have been attracted by weak environmental legislation. In Mexico City, 20 million people, 3 million cars, 100,000 buses and thousands of trucks create an enormous pollution problem. In Cubatao, in the Amazon rainforest forest, air pollution, water pollution and soil degradation are in tragic dimensions with 30% of deaths caused by respiratory problems.

results.title: Eight in the 80's
results.brief_description: Showcases eight interesting and innovative films made on the low budget medium of Super 8. Because of the gauge’s low cost and extreme flexibility the filmmakers using Super 8 have a freedom that allows them to create genuinely exciting and rich works, ranging from diaristic experimental films to straighter narrative dramas through to absurdist, surrealistic comedies.

It is a country with great potential in its natural resources and a level of poverty among the worst in the world.

results.title: Egypt: the habit of civilisation
results.creator_credit: Peter Spry-Leverton, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Maryland Public Television, Central Productions and ITV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Legacy”.
The civilisation of ancient Egypt was conservative in nature, drawing its optimistic base from the annual flooding of the Nile which brought sustenance to the nation. The unchanging stability of the cosmos was symbolised by divine kingship, centralised power and the massive buildings which represented that power. The many surrendered power to the few - a condition which still exists for the majority of people today. Similarly almost everyone today, shares the ancient Egyptians’ concern for life after death. Yet the conquests of Alexander, and the synthesis of cultures which followed, culminating in the dominance of Islam have done little to change these basic beliefs.

results.creator_credit: Audio Productions and Alfred Wagg Pictures

results.title: Egypt and Turkey
results.brief_description: Visit Egypt ‘the gift of the Nile” with a recorded history of more than five thousand years and experience the antiquities of Egypt such as the Sphinx and Great Pyramid in Giza. Travel to Cairo with its contrast of most modern city in the Middle East, but also mirror to an ancient past in bazaars, antiquities and museums. Visit also Alexandria once ruled by Alexander the Great and Cleopatra. In Turkey, visit Istanbul and the Turquoise Coast. Istanbul spans two continents and has been the capital of three empires: Byzantine, Holy Roman and Ottoman. Walk through the city’s old sector to see the monuments of these cultures.

results.title: Egypt and the Nile
results.creator_credit: Donald G. Hoffman and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents a picture of Egypt and the Nile Valley as seen against its historical background. Emphasises the importance of the Nile River in the whole pattern of Egyptian life. Includes scenes of an ancient temple to the sun god at Abu Simbel, the dam at Aswan, the delta of the Nile, the Suez Canal, and the cities of Asyut, Cairo, and Alexandria.
